title: Partner Development Manager, EMEA - International Banks
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead.
About the team
The International Banking Partnerships team sits within the Global Partnerships organization and is a key component of Stripe’s success. Our team is responsible for developing and managing Stripe’s relationships with the global and regional banks in EMEA and APAC that enable Stripe’s product strategy and deliver new capabilities to Stripe users. Our team executes on high-impact, cross-functional product partnership initiatives across existing products and new “up the stack” financial products. These partnerships have a significant impact on Stripe and are essential for us to offer products used by millions of our users.
What you’ll do
We are looking for a Partner Development Manager to join Stripe’s International Banks team in EMEA. You will be responsible for developing and executing the multi-year, global strategies for building Stripe’s relationships across many of our most important banking partners. You will focus on designing, scaling, and continuously improving mechanisms to deepen relationships with Stripe’s partners, as well as highly impactful programs key to differentiating Stripe. As part of these efforts, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional stakeholders (including Product, Engineering, Legal, Finance, Risk, etc.), and with the banking partners’ executive teams. 
 
The successful candidate will have a demonstrated ability to manage and develop partners; think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges; as well as earn trust with and influence others. A high agency attitude, ability to raise expectations in changing environments, driving impact through ownership are musts: 
Responsibilities

Manage and setup Stripe’s most critical banking partnerships in Europe, with a focus on driving the execution of joint initiatives and launching new product offerings to benefit Stripe users
Own the banking partner plans, the overall economics, day to day operational excellence and be responsible for the driving the partnerships to successful outcomes for Stripe 
Leverage banking, treasury and  payments industry knowledge to craft thoughtful partnership and product strategies with transaction banks, lenders, capital markets, central banks and schemes
Navigate, in partnership with Product BD, banking partners to execute deals supporting that strategy and help ensure proper execution plan in place
Gather inputs from and coordinate with internal cross-functional stakeholders (including risk, compliance, product, finance, treasury) on creation and execution of partner strategy
Help find the right partner stakeholders that can champion Stripe, educate them about Stripe’s value proposition, understand their needs, and execute deals that address those needs and support our strategy
Leverage significant industry experience to educate and help internal teams compose our holistic bank led strategy and to advance that strategy with banking partners
Monitoring of the changing Banking landscape and proactively advise Stripe on product opportunities that could be demonstrated, optimizing or replacing existing products

 
Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. 
Requirements
 

At least 10+  years of financial services experiences that includes directly working at banking institutions in cash management, FIG or payments; experience across  partner management or business development working with banking institutions in PSPs or fintechs enabling pay in/pay out, store value and/or embedded lending experiences
Advanced knowledge of the banking and clearing landscape in EMEA  with specific focus on transaction banking, e-money, safeguarding, multi currency and cross border payments. Added bonus if also experienced in business lending propositions. 
A proven track record of working in a product centric environment with significant internal and external dependencies across product, engineering, legal, sales, risk and compliance. 
Broad and deep experience executing industry-wide partnership strategies to build innovative product experiences and go to market models
Strong negotiation skills and ambitious on what we should try to do with our partners and how Stripe creates value and differentiation
An operationally focused mindset, with an ability to see challenging deals through to success, far beyond signing, leading teams through execution by using planning, metrics, and organizational structures
Having a mindset of contributing to the success of the team and overall company, outside of individual goals and objectives
Excellent english speaker with strong communication skills that are adaptable to internal and external environments. Other languages (German, French) are a bonus but not essential.

questions.label: Please select the country where you currently reside.
Please select the country or countries you anticipate working in for the role in which you are applying.
Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?
Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
